Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Interloper \In"ter*lo`per\ (?; 277), n. [Pref. inter- + D. looper a runner, fr. loopen to run; akin to E. leap. See {Leap}, and cf. {Elope}.] One who interlopes; one who unlawfully intrudes upon a property, a station, or an office; one who interferes wrongfully or officiously. [1913 Webster]
The untrained man, . . . the interloper as to the professions. --I. Taylor. [1913 Webster]
interloper n : someone who intrudes on the privacy or property of another without permission [syn: {intruder}, {trespasser}]
